bunpro.meaning: If luck is on my side, If the time is right, If possible, all going well

details.Get more example sentences!: Premium users get access to 12 example sentences on all Grammar Points.

bunpro.writeup: あわよくば is a combination of the old-fashioned い-Adjective あわよい 'convenient', 'timely', and the conjunction particle ば 'if'. It can be translated as 'if the time is right', 'if possible', or 'if luck is on my side'. Despite its roots, あわよくば is treated as a single word in modern Japanese, and is used in the same way as a typical adverb.あわよくば will come before a phrase expressing a desirable outcome.Fun FactNotice that ば attaches to the く form of the い-Adjective あわよい rather than けれ, as would usually be required with modern conjugation rules. This is due to the conjugation rules for ば in relation to い-Adjectives being different in both classical and modern Japanese.

examples.japanese: 競馬で勝って、あわよくば大金持ちになるぞ。
examples.english: If you win at the horse races, if you're lucky you'll become really rich!

examples.japanese: 議員：「あわよくばトップで当選したい。」
examples.english: Member of congress: 'If possible, I want to get elected to the top spot.'

examples.japanese: あわよくばミスコンで優勝したいと思っている。
examples.english: If luck is on my side, I am thinking that I would like to be the grand champion in the beauty pageant.

examples.japanese: この詐欺が成功したらあわよくば裕福になれる。
examples.english: If we succeed with this scam, all going well we'll be able to become wealthy.

examples.japanese: 会社の業績が上がった。あわよくば僕の給料も上がるかも。
examples.english: Our company performance improved. If I'm lucky my salary will improve too.
